name: IMRC
mission: IMRC has been working for over four decades to support Muslims and minorities in India. We fund education, healthcare, water access, economic programs, and emergency relief.
theoryOfChange: IMRC states it supports Muslims and minorities in India by funding year-round projects in education, healthcare, water access, economic programs, and emergency relief through 100+ partners on the ground, aiming to create real, measurable change.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.imrcusa.org/zakat (Source: https://www.imrcusa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Separate restricted/endowment funds from operating reserves and publish a clear reserve-use policy.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Indian Muslim Relief and Charities shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.imrcusa.org/zakat (Source: https://www.imrcusa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: IMRC reported total revenue of $13,833,809 and a program expense ratio of 89.8%.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for distribution.
IMRC's mission is to help India's Muslims and minorities achieve security, freedom, and equality.
The charity provides direct services including grain distribution and access to safe water.
IMRC programs include student support and water access initiatives.
The organization tracks metrics such as meals provided and patients treated.
IMRC has a long history of supporting students and providing healthcare treatment.
The charity builds wells and distributes meals to marginalized communities.
IMRC offers various giving methods to support its advocacy and relief efforts.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: IMRC earns a solid 73/100 due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct service model. While it demonstrates high alignment for Muslim donors, its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence levels.
areas_for_improvement: Limited recent third-party impact evaluations to verify long-term outcomes
Reliance on medium-confidence data for certain performance metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: With a high donor fit and a focus on urgent advocacy and relief for minorities, IMRC is highly aligned with the needs of the Muslim community [2]. The organization has a long track record of service dating back several years, consistently addressing systemic inequality through its healthcare and education programs [7][9].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high direct impact by allocating 89.8% of its $13,833,809 total revenue to programs [1]. Its direct service model provides tangible outcomes such as student support, patient treatment, and meal distribution [6][8]. However, the impact score of 41/50 reflects the absence of specific cost-per-beneficiary data despite strong annual reporting of outputs [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Indian Muslim Relief and Charities empowers India’s marginalized communities through robust education, healthcare, and emergency relief programs.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.8%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach beneficiaries
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with only $0.01 spent to raise every $1
Strong liquidity with 55.7 months of working capital available
Diverse program portfolio covering education, healthcare, and food security
baseline_narrative.summary: Indian Muslim Relief and Charities (IMRC) works to ensure India's Muslims and minorities achieve security, freedom, and equality as citizens [1][3]. The organization is Zakat-eligible and maintains a high level of financial transparency while delivering direct services across multiple sectors [2][4].

all_citations.quote: Help India's muslims and minorities achieve security, freedom, equality and their rights as citizens of India

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: IMRC earns a solid 73/100 due to its exceptional financial efficiency and direct service model. While it demonstrates high alignment for Muslim donors, its overall score is moderated by medium data confidence levels.

areas_for_improvement.detail: The organization has seen a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of -10.2%</cite>, suggesting a need to revitalize donor acquisition.
While annual reports provide high-level metrics, there is a need to <cite id="16">publish beneficiary counts consistently</cite> to allow for cost-per-beneficiary analysis.

bbb_assessment.summary: Financial statements are audited, but a full BBB Wise Giving Alliance review is not currently available.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's massive <cite id="6">$48.7 million asset base</cite> acts as a significant buffer against short-term revenue fluctuations.
risk_factors: <cite id="5">Negative 10.2% revenue growth</cite> over the last three years
<cite id="16">Inconsistent beneficiary data</cite> for cost-effectiveness modeling
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="5">downward trend in annual revenue</cite> and the lack of recent third-party impact evaluations.

confidence.data_freshness: Most data from 2023 Form 990 and 2021 Annual Report
confidence.notes: Strong financial data, but impact evidence relies on internal reporting.

alignment.explanation: IMRC is a <cite id="10">zakat-eligible organization</cite> that specifically serves <cite id="11">underserved Muslim and minority populations</cite> in India.
alignment.improvement: The organization could improve alignment by <cite id="20">expanding services to geographies</cite> with even more limited nonprofit coverage within India.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust IMRC due to its <cite id="1">45-year track record</cite> and a board with <cite id="15">100% independent members</cite>. The organization maintains <cite id="6">nearly $49 million in assets</cite> with negligible liabilities.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization should <cite id="17">separate restricted funds from operating reserves</cite> and publish a formal reserve-use policy.

impact.explanation: IMRC utilizes a <cite id="18">direct service delivery model</cite> with a <cite id="19">program expense ratio of 89.8%</cite> according to recent filings, though internal benchmarks suggest higher efficiency in specific years.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="16">consistent annual publication of beneficiary data</cite> to verify cost-effectiveness across all programs.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Internal outcome tracking via annual reports

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery through local chapters and staff

rich_narrative.headline: Indian Muslim Relief and Charities empowers India’s marginalized communities through robust education, healthcare, and emergency relief programs.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support the long-term resilience of Muslim communities in India through an established institution with deep local roots.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations for needy Muslims in India
Value financial stability and low fundraising costs
Prefer supporting organizations with a multi-decade track record
Care about holistic development (health, education, and food)
giving_considerations: Large reserves mean your gift contributes to long-term sustainability
The organization is currently navigating a period of revenue contraction
Direct service model ensures tangible outputs like meals and medical treatments
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-growth 'startup' charities or those requiring recent independent RCT-level evidence.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects consistent internal reporting of outputs (e.g., <cite id="13">16.4M meals</cite>) without external longitudinal impact studies.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: IMRC aims to alleviate poverty by providing the essential pillars of <cite id="22">education, healthcare, and clean water</cite> to marginalized minorities.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Consistent evidence ensures that large-scale distributions translate into long-term poverty reduction.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite large reserves, the <cite id="5">decline in annual revenue</cite> suggests a significant need for new funding to maintain program scale.

peer_comparison.differentiator: IMRC is distinguished by its <cite id="12">68-month working capital ratio</cite>, which is far higher than the <cite id="21">89.8% peer program ratio median</cite> context.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focuses on US advocacy rather than direct Indian humanitarian aid
similar_organizations.name: COUNCIL ON AMERICAN-ISLAMIC RELATIONS CALIFORNIA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Smaller scale and domestic US focus

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="7">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite>, which is significantly better than industry benchmarks.
With a <cite id="1">founding date in 1981</cite>, IMRC has over four decades of experience navigating the complex humanitarian landscape in India.
IMRC maintains <cite id="12">55.7 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing extraordinary long-term stability.

strengths_deep_dive: IMRC's strength lies in its ability to scale direct services across multiple sectors. Their healthcare program demonstrated significant capacity by <cite id="9">treating 183,100 patients in 2021</cite>, while their feeding programs provided <cite id="13">16.4 million meals in 2020</cite>. This scale is supported by a <cite id="14">14-member board</cite> that ensures <cite id="15">100% independent oversight</cite>, maintaining high standards of governance and accountability.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1981</cite>, Indian Muslim Relief and Charities (IMRC) is a veteran humanitarian organization dedicated to helping <cite id="2">India's Muslims and minorities achieve security, freedom, and equality</cite>. The organization operates a sophisticated direct-service model that spans education, healthcare, and emergency relief. In the 2023 fiscal year, IMRC reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $13,833,809</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="4">$13.39 million in public contributions</cite>. Despite a <cite id="5">3-year revenue CAGR of -10.2%</cite>, the organization maintains a robust financial position with <cite id="6">$48.78 million in total assets</cite> and virtually no debt. IMRC's operational efficiency is highlighted by its <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are not consumed by administrative overhead. Their impact is extensive; for instance, in 2021 alone, they <cite id="8">supported 16,493 students</cite> and <cite id="9">treated 183,100 patients</cite> through their healthcare initiatives. The organization is <cite id="10">zakat-eligible</cite>, providing a verified channel for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations toward the <cite id="11">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite> in India.
